messages: f52974b56ef747f73d918e80a6de21c6 (03:45): man... I so prefered bigendian cpu's... *sigh*
5677ca358f85d384f7b12e9f5cfbb27d (03:46): Moridin8: what are you up to?
11fcd5cb44b5fee3cc0ae7f2d1a6a238 (03:47): its possible to reference an .exe right?
11fcd5cb44b5fee3cc0ae7f2d1a6a238 (03:47): so i should make all the types in that assembly be internal so the "average" coder cant get into it?
f52974b56ef747f73d918e80a6de21c6 (03:47): I hate the way x86 CPU's do their byte order in memory... (messing with pointers)
5677ca358f85d384f7b12e9f5cfbb27d (03:48): AnarkiNet: what is your goal?
f52974b56ef747f73d918e80a6de21c6 (03:48): in an int, x86 stores the vaue 1 this:   01 00 00 00
11fcd5cb44b5fee3cc0ae7f2d1a6a238 (03:48): well
11fcd5cb44b5fee3cc0ae7f2d1a6a238 (03:48): its a closed source commercial application
f52974b56ef747f73d918e80a6de21c6 (03:48): with 68k... 1 would be stored thus:  00 00 00 01
5677ca358f85d384f7b12e9f5cfbb27d (03:48): I try to avoid writing code where I can tell the difference
f52974b56ef747f73d918e80a6de21c6 (03:48): makes more sense
5677ca358f85d384f7b12e9f5cfbb27d (03:48): AnarkiNet: are you using multiple assemblies?
11fcd5cb44b5fee3cc0ae7f2d1a6a238 (03:48): yeah
11fcd5cb44b5fee3cc0ae7f2d1a6a238 (03:48): well
11fcd5cb44b5fee3cc0ae7f2d1a6a238 (03:48): theres LibMUSE
11fcd5cb44b5fee3cc0ae7f2d1a6a238 (03:49): which contains all the free stuff
5677ca358f85d384f7b12e9f5cfbb27d (03:49): so presumably you must have public members in those assemblies?
11fcd5cb44b5fee3cc0ae7f2d1a6a238 (03:49): yes
11fcd5cb44b5fee3cc0ae7f2d1a6a238 (03:49): but i'm talking about the .exe
11fcd5cb44b5fee3cc0ae7f2d1a6a238 (03:49): not the dll
5677ca358f85d384f7b12e9f5cfbb27d (03:49): personally I wouldn't bother
11fcd5cb44b5fee3cc0ae7f2d1a6a238 (03:49): the library is obviously full of public members
11fcd5cb44b5fee3cc0ae7f2d1a6a238 (03:49): well
5677ca358f85d384f7b12e9f5cfbb27d (03:49): ildasm/ilasm isn't very difficult
11fcd5cb44b5fee3cc0ae7f2d1a6a238 (03:49): hmm
5677ca358f85d384f7b12e9f5cfbb27d (03:49): unless you are going to go with some additional other protection
5677ca358f85d384f7b12e9f5cfbb27d (03:50): e.g. a decent obfuscator
11fcd5cb44b5fee3cc0ae7f2d1a6a238 (03:50): should i sign my assemblies?
f52974b56ef747f73d918e80a6de21c6 (03:50): anarki: always
5677ca358f85d384f7b12e9f5cfbb27d (03:50): there's no real reason not to

11fcd5cb44b5fee3cc0ae7f2d1a6a238 (03:51): well, basically i want both the server and the class library to be freely usable for non commercial purposes but i need a way to keep a company from using it without paying
5677ca358f85d384f7b12e9f5cfbb27d (03:51): you can use licensing
5677ca358f85d384f7b12e9f5cfbb27d (03:51): which stops your assemblies working on unauthorised computers
f52974b56ef747f73d918e80a6de21c6 (03:51): Anarki:  yeh good luck
11fcd5cb44b5fee3cc0ae7f2d1a6a238 (03:51): hmmm
5677ca358f85d384f7b12e9f5cfbb27d (03:51): and as long as only you can authorise machines, they can't distribute
5677ca358f85d384f7b12e9f5cfbb27d (03:52): someone who cares enough can of course break this
11fcd5cb44b5fee3cc0ae7f2d1a6a238 (03:52): the other thing i was thinking of would be to not release the server executable at all
5677ca358f85d384f7b12e9f5cfbb27d (03:52): but same goes for any code in any language
11fcd5cb44b5fee3cc0ae7f2d1a6a238 (03:52): right
11fcd5cb44b5fee3cc0ae7f2d1a6a238 (03:52): yeah, i'm not going to worry about absolute 100% lockdown
5677ca358f85d384f7b12e9f5cfbb27d (03:52): AnarkiNet: arguably the best way to deal with this is to sue anyone who tries
11fcd5cb44b5fee3cc0ae7f2d1a6a238 (03:53): i fully understand the "any electronic security system can be breached" fact
11fcd5cb44b5fee3cc0ae7f2d1a6a238 (03:53): but then i'll need a phone-home built into the dll or something :P
5677ca358f85d384f7b12e9f5cfbb27d (03:53): if you don't notice it, why does it matter?
5677ca358f85d384f7b12e9f5cfbb27d (03:53): and if you do notice it, then you've noticed
11fcd5cb44b5fee3cc0ae7f2d1a6a238 (03:53): well
11fcd5cb44b5fee3cc0ae7f2d1a6a238 (03:53): my project is a development tool
11fcd5cb44b5fee3cc0ae7f2d1a6a238 (03:53): so its hard to notice if a company is using it behind closed doors without consent
11fcd5cb44b5fee3cc0ae7f2d1a6a238 (03:54): unless for example an audit is done of the company's machines or something
5677ca358f85d384f7b12e9f5cfbb27d (03:54): that's not the same as them calling your internal methods though
5677ca358f85d384f7b12e9f5cfbb27d (03:54): that's them using your code without licenses
11fcd5cb44b5fee3cc0ae7f2d1a6a238 (03:54): hmm
11fcd5cb44b5fee3cc0ae7f2d1a6a238 (03:54): well, i'm somewhat new to commercial software, heh
5677ca358f85d384f7b12e9f5cfbb27d (03:55): a common solution is Xheo
11fcd5cb44b5fee3cc0ae7f2d1a6a238 (03:55): all my projects before have been open source
5677ca358f85d384f7b12e9f5cfbb27d (03:55): I've used it, it's ok
5677ca358f85d384f7b12e9f5cfbb27d (03:55): what does your product do btw?
11fcd5cb44b5fee3cc0ae7f2d1a6a238 (03:55): its a multi-user editing engine
5677ca358f85d384f7b12e9f5cfbb27d (03:55): simultaneous?
11fcd5cb44b5fee3cc0ae7f2d1a6a238 (03:55): yes
11fcd5cb44b5fee3cc0ae7f2d1a6a238 (03:55): but its being designed to be not restricted to text
11fcd5cb44b5fee3cc0ae7f2d1a6a238 (03:56): which is what everything i've been able to find before has been restricted too
11fcd5cb44b5fee3cc0ae7f2d1a6a238 (03:56): to*
11fcd5cb44b5fee3cc0ae7f2d1a6a238 (03:56): eh?
5677ca358f85d384f7b12e9f5cfbb27d (03:56): is it model view controller based?
11fcd5cb44b5fee3cc0ae7f2d1a6a238 (03:56): er
11fcd5cb44b5fee3cc0ae7f2d1a6a238 (03:56): i dont know what that is, so probably not
502458c06721a62682c0c840229afaf1 (03:56): i have a form where you have to enter some info and I want it to activate a button when the user hits enter.. is there an easy way to do this?
5677ca358f85d384f7b12e9f5cfbb27d (03:57): are you happy to talk about the design behind it?
5677ca358f85d384f7b12e9f5cfbb27d (03:57): [BAF64]: set the button's Default property to true
11fcd5cb44b5fee3cc0ae7f2d1a6a238 (03:57): Theory, yeah, i'm going to document all that pretty extensively
5677ca358f85d384f7b12e9f5cfbb27d (03:57): [BAF64]: sorry, I think it's the form's AcceptButton property
